TcpKnnH 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Identify the Best Partitions Based on Macro-F1 or Micro-F1

    maf1.best.partitions.Rd

    This function evaluates different partitions using either the Macro-F1 or Micro-F1 metric and identifies the best-performing partitions for each fold in a k-nearest neighbors (KNN) classification setting. The results are stored in CSV files for further analysis.

    maf1.best.partitions(parameters)

    Arguments

    parameters

    A list containing necessary configuration settings, including:

    • Best: An integer indicating whether Macro-F1 (8) or Micro-F1 (other values) is used.

    • Folders: A list with folder paths, including:

      • folderReports – Path to report folder.

      • folderValMaF1 – Path to Macro-F1 validation folder.

      • folderValMiF1 – Path to Micro-F1 validation folder.

    • Dataset.Info: A list with dataset metadata, including:

      • Labels – Number of labels in the dataset.

    • Number.Folds: Number of cross-validation folds.

    Value

    The function does not return a value but generates multiple CSV files summarizing:

    • The best partitions for each KNN value.

    • The frequency of best partitions.

    • Summary statistics (mean, median, standard deviation, min, max).

    Details

    The function follows these steps:

    1. Reads the sparcification.csv file to determine the number of KNN values (s).

    2. Iterates over each KNN value, evaluating different partitions.

    3. Reads and processes validation results stored in CSV files.

    4. Identifies the best-performing partition for each fold.

    5. Saves summary statistics and frequency counts for the best partitions.

    Examples

    params <- list(
  Best = 8,
  Folders = list(
    folderReports = "path/to/reports",
    folderValMaF1 = "path/to/val/macro",
    folderValMiF1 = "path/to/val/micro"
  ),
  Dataset.Info = list(Labels = 10),
  Number.Folds = 10
)
maf1.best.partitions(params)
#> 
#> 
#> #=================================================#
#> # MACRO F1                                        #
#> #=================================================#
#> 
#> Error in setwd(parameters$Folders$folderReports): cannot change working directory
